title: Figure of Bodhisattvas, one of a pair
text: Although mirror images of each other, these two statues do not likely represent the same bodhisattva but more probably the popular deities Maitraya and Avalokitesvara. Standing in graceful posture holding the stalk of a lotus flower, they likely formed part of a sculptural triad flanking a larger bronze image of the Buddha.
description: standing gilt bronze figure in contraposto position, proper     left hand in front of body with fingers together pointing upward, right hand down at side holding draped fabric
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
